data.text: @janetwagner21 I can’t wait to get mine! Looks like it will be sometime in June!
@janetwagner21 We can hardly wait to get ours!
@janetwagner21 Yeah!! Excellent - good for you.
@CJ_Toronto @ConcernedPah @janetwagner21 Yes.  True.
@janetwagner21 I’m hearing so much deliberate misinformation about roll out from people that know better. I have no words at this time. It is so bad.

@CJ_Toronto @ConcernedPah @ProudGrannyCdn Good to know. I trust I have a strong immune system. Haven't been sick with so much as a cold since the fall of 2009 when my boy came home from school sick with H1N1. I caught it from him. Knocked me down for 2 whole days. I've never had a flu shot, but I am going to start now.
@tosajohn Well aware. Nothing has changed in my daily routine since the pandemic began & nothing will for quite some time, I'm sure.

@ConcernedPah @ProudGrannyCdn @janetwagner21 Actually, in this case, you want "side effects."

They're proof of your immune system kicking in.

@janetwagner21 Janet, 
Might I suggest you wait two weeks for your body to build the antibodies against the AZ vaccine and hence against the Covid before venturing out? Please? Thank you.
@janetwagner21 I’m happy you’ve rec’d it Janet! Good for you!
@janetwagner21 We did not get symptoms til 2nd day.  Am thrilled and relieved to have it.

@janetwagner21 @ProudGrannyCdn My daughter in BC received the Covishield first shot yesterday & had typical flu vaccine side effects last night quite bad, but is feeling better today. So glad she was able to get it!

@janetwagner21 Yay! I found the isolation of staying home during covid not a big deal. I had nowhere or $$ to go, anywhere.  I do enjoy my walks, and looking for quality food bargains! My outings in general. Perhaps in 2022, a free senior class at a university!
@janetwagner21 I don’t mind needles.  I’m so happy that the available bookings are full and Nova Scotians are getting it done!

@janetwagner21 I went into my local pharmacy this morning to make an appointment and there had just been a cancellation so got mine then and there! I wasn’t caring what vaccine I got. If felt such a relief to get one.

@ProudGrannyCdn @janetwagner21 I think you're right. My daughter has had her second dose of Pfizer and had some mild side effects after her second dose. My doctor said it was the same for him. I'll take that over Covid any day.
@janetwagner21 @sailorgirl2017 Totally agree. Got mine yesterday. No problem.
@janetwagner21 Same here. Got it last Wednesday, no side effects to report. I'm grateful to get any vaccine and I'm still hunkered down for now.
@janetwagner21 Yes, the data looks great!
@millerd99 I was a bit apprehensive of AZ at first, but I'm glad now that I bit the bullet.  It's sounding better all the time. https://t.co/wO5j8k4emr
@janetwagner21 Exactly! I was fortunate to be vaccinated on Saturday with AstraZeneca and am feeling fine. Everyone should take the first one offered.

@ProudGrannyCdn Perhaps. But this was my first dosage and I was advised by the nurse of a long list of possible side effects and vaccine related symptoms, most of them similar to the side effects of the typical flu vaccine. Was also given a handout listing the possible side effects.
@janetwagner21 I think it is the second dose that the side effects happen...
@PollyMath1 Piece of cake. I hate needles and have fainted in the past, but I'm okay as long as I don't see the needle. The nurse who vaccinated me was so awesome.  Very quick and painless process.
@janetwagner21 I get my first AZ shot today.
